thread.title: Social media turning Trump's executive orders into memes with hilarious results
thread.title_full: Social media turning Trump's executive orders into memes with hilarious results - seattlepi.com

title: Social media turning Trump's executive orders into memes with hilarious results
text:
President Donald Trump has made a habit of holding up signed executive orders for the cameras.
And in his less than two weeks in office he has put his signature on many orders, ranging from one to build a wall along the US-Mexico border to another banning refugees and placing restrictions on immigration from seven predominantly Muslim countries.
Social media has had a field day with the images of Trump posing with his signed documents and used Photoshop to show Trump holding up everything from stick-figure self-portraits to a collection of Pok√©mon cards.
There's even a Twitter account called @TrumpDraws dedicated to memes showing Trump holding up rudimentary, childish drawings.
President Donald Trump has been making an unusual number of executive orders since he arrived in office. While the fast acting legislation has been related to platforms he promised in the past, Congress has not stepped up and agreed to or bucked any of the laws. Now, some are beginning to place the blame on Congress for being against Trump as if executive orders were his last resort.
Media: MediaOS Video Take a look at the memes spreading across the Twitterverse above.
